intro: Vernonanthura nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flowered vernonanthura, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
